Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
EDIT: I just noticed something, there are many paid fake reviews of this game on steam, which is why it skewed the ratings to "Mostly Positive"

Please keep in mind this scummy tactic before you choose to support this creator.

Original Review:
There are way too many jarring problems with these game. To name a few that stood out the most:

* Launching the game in VR, you need to remove your headset and start the game via the unity startup box in your desktop monitor
* You're put directly in a dark room with flags for language that is way too close to your face
* You have absolutely no indicator what you're actually supposed to do and the hints/prompts are extremely vague
* That pretty much means you just randomly try ♥♥♥♥ and realise "Oh, so i can do that apparently)
* Also there are no menus, options or any UI at all to access and tweak settings.
* The "puzzles" in the game are so poorly done... It is either really boring/uninteresting (Match these items to the picture) or it is extremely unintuitive/senseless (Shoot your arrow at this random target/find the key which is hidden in a location you cant actually walk too)

Now the worse offender of all, is how useless a lot of what is touted or advertised in this game actually is. The following actions add literally 0 value to the game:

* The ability to freeze time - Has absolutely no use
* The ability to rewind time - The only time to use this is if you chucked something important into the abyss
* The ability to shoot arrows - Combat looks more like it was slapped together with whatever just so they can advertise there is combat. Removing these element would change pretty much nothing.

The game was released in 2017 and the end of the game advertises more levels. Considering its 2021 i think its safe to say that was ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

On top of that, time taken to complete this game, including me faffing about, was 0.6 hour... Id like to point out this game is advertised at $10. If you could miraculously know what to do and didnt faff around, it would take approximately 20 minutes to FULLY complete the game.

Overall, the concept is interesting and could do with a lot of polish and extension but the game advertised here is complete and utter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2017
TimeLock VR - вперед в прошлое в поисках вазы.

Сюжет.
Изобрели мы машину времени, что будем делать? Правильно, воровать антикварные вазы из домов! Сюжет есть, но он для галочки.

Геймплей.
По сути эта игра жанра - "найди выход из комнаты" (читай, найди вазу в комнате), но с небольшим добавлением тира. Добавление имхо несколько выбивается из основной канвы. Как фича мы можем отправляться в прошлое, в то как квартира выглядела несколько десятилетий назад. Жаль только что не возможно сделать какие-то изменения в прошлом, которые бы заметно отразились на настоящем, по крайней мере из того что не вписывается в сюжет.

Графика и звуки.
Картинка в целом приличная, хотя когда мы вылазим на улицу в искаженное пространство, все выглядит странновато, и опять же имхо выбивается из основной темы. Эффект перемещения во времени, выглядит довольно красиво. Музыка идет фоном и не замечается, но вот сигнал подсказки, несколько бьёт по мозгам.

Как итог.
В целом получился короткий, крепкий середнячок, жанра "найди выход из комнаты", с интересной возможностью менять время, к сожалению не использованной по максимуму. Некий, восточный принц в печали. Пройти можно, но имхо не шедевр.
6 ваз из 10
На один раз.

Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

I got this game from a friend who had a key for it but didn't own a VR headset, and by giving it to me he dodged a bullet because this by far the worst VR game I've ever played so far. It is extremely underbaked and totally wastes it's interesting concept.

There's problems right from the start as the game as the game doesn't boot up immediately; it has the standard Unity settings window which will only appear on your desktop forcing you to either take off your headset or go into SteamVR's virtual desktop just to start the actual game. Once it boots up the language select is right in your face and you can't see all the flags without stepping back a bit.

The game starts with a very clunky tutorial that takes place in a dark room where you can't even see your controller properly. The thing you have to interact with to progress the tutorial is easy to miss and as a result I messed up the starting room a lot on my first time playing just trying to figure out what to do, so I had to restart the game. The tutorial is not designed for non-Vive controllers as well and your "hands" are always styled like the Vive controllers. It does at least overlay a silhouette of your non-Vive controller to show you button inputs.

As for the game itself? Imagine a bad flash point and click game in VR. That's pretty much it. There's only one puzzle in the game that's more than just "find an item and put it in it's marked location" or "find a number and input it in it's marked location". What about the time manipulation mechanics you ask? They're not used by the game at all. No puzzles make use of it and the only time mechanic you'd ever need to use is the rewind, because there's a section where you have to throw a bunch of objects at silhouettes of themselves and rewinding is the only way to get them back if you missed. If you're good at throwing stuff in VR, you can beat the game without ever using the time manipulation outside of the tutorial.

The other main mechanic (which actually DOES get some use, shocker) is swapping between the past and present version of the house you're in. It's not used for much outside of bringing items to and from the different eras and getting into rooms which are locked in one era but not the other. Twice in the game you will run into the titular Timelock (announced by a voice shouting "TIMELOCK!" rather than anything interesting), which I think is supposed to be some kind of paradox situation but it's very hard to tell thanks to the poor translation of your mission control's dialogue.

The Timelock itself is just a void area made up of random objects, which I wouldn't be surprised if they came from the Unity asset store (such as a billboard with "PLACE YOUR PICTURE HERE" written on it) and untextured cubes. In it you have to fight flying enemies that look like they came from a bad Game Builder Garage game. They make no sounds at all and as a result have no audio feedback for their position and the shots they fire. Don't worry though! They cannot harm you in any way at all. This game has no failstate whatsoever. To "fight" them, you use a longbow that feels EXACTLY the same as the longbow in The Lab, down to the sounds. Since that was made in Unity (outside of Robot Repair) I wouldn't be surprised if it was a flat-out stolen asset from The Lab. This longbow is also never used for puzzles at all, outside of one target you have to hit to proceed which is more of a tutorial.

The game as a whole is very unpolished. It's easy to grab objects when they're supposed to be behind walls or place them out of bounds, and they'll often launch themselves at the slightest movement. There's nothing to stop you from poking your head inside walls either. You can't rotate or reset your orientation at all, so you'll often have troubling doing stuff if your headset's tracking only comes from one direction. There's also a floor grid that cannot be disabled and seems to try and render in front of everything. (why it isn't just visible when you're moving like in SteamVR Home is beyond me) When I got to the final "boss" for some reason the game wouldn't let me equip the longbow, softlocking the game. I had to restart the whole thing because the game has no saving at all.

What happens when you "beat" the game? All it does is lock you in a single room with a message that says (I'm paraphrasing here) "Thanks for playing episode 1! Stay tuned for more episodes!". The game released in 2018 and hasn't had a single update since. This whole game feels like a scam. The store page makes no mention of this being a "part one" of something. The "fully intractable environment" means nothing other than being able to pick up every prop. (this ain't HL:A) The logo artwork on the store doesn't resemble anything that appears in the game. There's no semblance of a consistent artstyle throughout the game (the mission control in particular looks like some kind of furry creature that's totally out of place) that makes me suspect this is cobbled together from Unity asset store assets. The game costs £9.99 but is also included in a bundle that's always discounted at 99%, almost as if to prey on people looking for sales or with leftover Steam credit.

In conclusion? This game is a total waste of your time and money. It doesn't use it's central concept in any way and is incredibly slapped-together. If you know what you're doing, you can beat this in less than 10 minutes. The only reason I can think of this game having a "mostly positive" rating is because of alt accounts or paid bots; most reviews just have a basic description of the game rather than any actual praising/critiques and one review is almost the exact same as another, word-for-word. This game is a prime example of Steam shovelware and isn't worth the £0.20 you can get it for in a bundle.
 
Yoshiatom

Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2018
A bit misleading - this is actually a pretty straightforward 'room escape' type puzzle with a core gimmick of moving between parallel worlds (different times). There is no usage of the freeze time power. The archery mechanic is literally just Valves longbow tech demo, with only a few enemies total in the game (12+1 bigger-and-more-health 'boss', iirc), none of whom pose any actual threat (or maybe I've just played too much Longbow already).

As a room escape puzzle, it's not terrible, but also not especially significant or clever relative to the many free experiences, which puts me in the too-common position of having to make a recommendation (becausue it's a 'totally fine' VR indie game) but qualify it as a 'not really'.

The #1 top complaint I have about the game itself is PLEASE TURN OFF THE FLOOR GRID. IIRC this is a simple check-box in the floor script (in Unity editor) to have the grid only show when there is a teleporter cursor active on them, and it would enormously improve the overall look and feel of the game.

Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2017
"TimeLock VR is an Escape the Room with Action elements where you take control over the time!"

The above is true but you are not stuck in one room and this game does have free roaming and shooting. The puzzle aspect is implemented but probably not too hard for most people. A good mix of action (shooter), puzzle and adventure with a slight story thrown in there too. Because of the time travel aspect and mix of genre the graphics vary from level to level. Overall, they are good and clear. Time travel is used to find items and clues. For $4.99 it is a great game to have in the library. The newer big games might take most of our time but let's not forget our Indie devs who are trying to give us unique experiences as well. Support this title. My rating 8/10 for the creativity of the title.

Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2021
In the early days of commercial VR, back in 2017, someone made a 30-minute puzzle game about finding a few hidden objects and time travelling at will between two different versions of the same area. He put it on sale for the outrageous price of $8.99.

I bought Timelock VR for an outrageous price, though my price was literally 5¢ because I bought it as part of the WRG bundle at -96% off. https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/7396/WRG_bundle/

2017 was also a time when developers sometimes developed for one headset or another, and in this case Timelock VR was made for the HTC Vive and its Vive Wands. I played with an Oculus Rift and the controls worked fine once I figured out how to do it.

The key to playing this with an Oculus Touch kit is to recognize that the model of Vive wands you hold in-game have a radial display of icons on each controller. With a Vive wand you would press the trackpad in the direction of the icons to activate those functions. Oculus Touch has thumbsticks in place of trackpads, but the idea is the same. Angle the thumbstick in the appropriate direction (e.g., Up for the bow) and press the thumbstick down until it clicks. Simple.

The game has teleport only, but I think that's fine for this game. The biggest controls problem I had was the lack of artificial rotation. Physically moving is mandatory, which meant I had problems with tracking when my body blocked the controllers.

I had to stop playing midway through my first session of the game. When I came back to it, I was right back at the beginning of the game. No worries, since I knew where to find the hidden objects and was able to get back to where I'd left off in about five minutes.

The game is extremely short and barebones. I suppose that's why there's no save system. There is no challenge other than it took me a while to find the last key, which was more sneakily hidden than any of the other objects.

The unique thing about this game is the fact it has bow combat, but there are ten enemies in the entire game and none of them do anything threatening. They don't even have sound effects! The time pausing and rewinding features are also potentially interesting, but go completely unused. It's almost as if the game is incomplete or something...

The game ends with a message congratulating me on completing the first episode of Timelock VR and promises to let me know "when the new missions be available [sic]."

I don't think there will ever be new missions. That's fine by me.

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2023
Time Lock VR 1

„Time Lock” to całkiem ciekawa produkcja, w której wcielamy się w podróżującego w czasie złodzieja. Możemy zatrzymywać, wstrzymywać i cofać czas różnych obiektów, włączając w to cały świat. Mimo że napisałem, że można zatrzymać i cofnąć czas obiektów, to jednak ta funkcja okazała się dosyć bezużyteczna. Osobiście nie użyłem jej ani razu, a cofałem czas tylko na początku, gdy nie wiedziałem, co się dzieje, i przypadkowo naciskałem przyciski. Gra była całkiem ok (jednak bardziej na minusie). Niestety i ta gra nie jest wolna od swoich minusów. Pojawiamy się w bardzo ciemnym pomieszczeniu bez żadnych instrukcji i musimy ogarnąć, co się dzieje. Osobiście przez dziesięć minut próbowałem zrozumieć, gdzie jestem i co mam robić. Gdy już się zorientowałem, gra pomału nabierała tempa. Dowiadujemy się, że naszym celem jest kradzież pieciowiecznej wazy. Skaczemy w czasie, by znaleźć nowe przedmioty, umożliwiające otwieranie kolejnych poziomów. Zagadki są bardzo łatwe, wręcz banalne. Co więcej, w trakcie gry napotykamy na „Time Lock”, czyli coś na wzór rozłamu czasu, czyli anomalie, które mają miejsce, gdy zachodzi zmiana w czasoprzestrzeni. Odnosi się to do koncepcji, w której pewne obszary czasoprzestrzeni są zamknięte, zabezpieczone lub niemożliwe do zmiany. Tak naprawdę, przez całą grę robimy to samo. Gra jest trochę nudna i dodatkowo krótka, bo zajęła mi zaledwie pół godziny.

Grafika jest spoko, choć może być lepsza. Efekty wizualne trochę przeciętne. Dźwięki i muzyka są takie sobie, mogłyby być bardziej zajmujące. Ogólnie spoko, ale dałoby się poprawić.

Podsumowanie

Gra, mimo ciekawego konceptu, niestety zawodzi w wykonaniu. Jest zbyt krótka, mało intuicyjna i po prostu nudna. Gdyby oferowała więcej treści i była lepiej wykonana, chętnie wystawiłbym pozytywną recenzję. Niestety, muszę się jednak ograniczyć do opinii negatywnej.

2.5/10

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2020
Bei "TimeLock VR" handelt es sich um ein kurzes und sehr leichtes EscapeRoom-Spiel, welches mich aber trotzdem an die Brille gefesselt hat.
Time Lock VR 1  
Une capture d'écran de Time Lock VR 1
Par : Overblast

Zu Anfang werden uns die Funktionen des Spiels beigebracht, wie wir die Zeit manipulieren können. Das hört sich jetzt aufregender an als es ist. Faktisch benutzen wir nämlich nur den Zeitsprung. Das anhalten und zurückspulen der Zeit wird im gesamten Spiel nicht ein einziges mal gebraucht. Nach der Einleitung fangen wir auch gleich mit unserer "Mission" an, nämlich das beschaffen einer antiken Vase. Um diese zu bekommen wechseln wir mehrmals zwischen zwei Epochen herum. Was wir suchen wird uns immer direkt am betreffenden Objekt angezeigt. An geschlossenen Türen leuchtet zum Beispiel ein gelbes Schlüssel Symbol, an einer Truhe ein Zangen Symbol. Dadurch ist alles recht einfach und eigent sich besonders für EscapeRoom Neulinge. Ab und an müßen wir uns mit einem obligatorischen VR-Flitzebogen gegen Dronen behaupten, nichts Weltbewegendes. Nach nichtmal einer Stunde sind wir dann aber auch schon mit dem Spiel durch.
Time Lock VR 1  
Une capture d'écran de Time Lock VR 1
Par : Overblast

Grafisch sieht alles recht schön and realistisch aus. Gerade im 1910 sieht die Wohnungseinrichtung richtig schön urig aus. Die Texturen sind scharf und sehr detailliert und auch die Soundkulisse ist OK. Im Sale für unter einem Euro kann man definitiv nichts falsch machen.

Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2019
I'm not quite sure how to categorise this one. It has simple aspects of an escape room and a couple of bow and arrow shooting sections. The puzzles mostly consist of picking things up until your controller buzzes to tell you you've found something. There is a puzzle at the start which seems slightly unfair as you are surrounded by books and need an object which looks very much like just another book. The central gimmick is the time travelling but the house in the game feels so isolated that you don't really get any sense of time travel. It feel more like moving from one section of Ikea to another. If there were windows with some kind of view, or background sounds or something then it could have been made so much more interesting. Plus, the timelock sections just reinforce the idea that you aren't in a real place as you walk out of the room into some weird simulation space.

Either way, the puzzles are fairly simple (with the exception of the initial one which is quite rude), some of the physics is pretty glitchy and the overall game is really short. Overall this probably deserves a "Maybe" recommendation, but given the number of better games available, I'm erring on the side of No, unless you are a particular fan of the genre and/or you see it at a decent discount.

Also, it's a minor point, but launching this game from in VR is awkward. It just appears to freeze up when actually a dialog has appeared on the desktop asking you what resolution to start up at and you need to jump to the desktop view in order to accept.

Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2018
TimeLock VR ist ein Escaperoom-Spiel mit einigen besonderen Elementen. (getestet mit der HTC Vive)
Als "Time Agent" versuchen wir ein Verbrechen aufzuklären und können dafür durch die Zeit reisen.
Das Spiel beginnt in einem Haus, wo wir auch gleich durch ein kleines Tutorial geführt werden, um unsere verschiedenen Fähigkeiten kennen zu lernen. Neben der Möglichkeit in die Vergangenheit zu reisen steht und auch noch ein Bogen zur Verfügung um gelegentliche Feinde abzuschießen. Ob es dieses "Minispiel" zwischendurch gebraucht hätte, lasse ich mal dahingestellt.
Ansonsten bedient sich das Spiel bekannter Mechaniken, ala suche einen Schlüssel, finde einen Code usw. Dafür müssen wir teils Gegenstände aus den verschiedenen Zeiten zusammenführen, um die Rätsel zu lösen, nette Idee.
Die Gegenstände können wir direkt in die Hand nehmen oder per Telekinese zu uns ziehen. Durch die verschiedenen Räume bewegen wir uns per Teleportation. Unsere Aufgaben erhalten wir über einen kleinen Bildschirm, den wir per Menütaste aufrufen können.
Die Grafik ist soweit in Ordnung, wenn auch nicht perfekt. Leider kann man teils durch Schranktüren und Schubladen durchgreifen und hält plötzlich den Inhalt in der Hand, statt die Schublade zu öffnen. Aber das kann man bei einem Preis von 4,99 verzeihen.
Ansonsten macht das Spiel einen ganz guten Eindruck, vor allem, dass es auch die deutsche Übersetzung gibt, sollte positiv erwähnt werden. Die Rätsel sind angemessen und nicht übermäßig schwer, das Reisen zwischen den Zeiten funktioniert einwandfrei, lediglich die Passagen mit Gegnern fand ich überflüssig, aber das ist sicher geschmackssache.
Beim ersten Start musste ich auf dem Monitor noch irgendetwas anklicken, damit das Spiel überhaupt anläuft, war am Anfang etwas irritierend, da ich schon dachte, es würde nicht starten.
Außerdem habe ich irgendwie noch nicht herausgefunden, wie man das Spiel speichert, ist entweder nicht vorgesehen, was definitiv ein negativer Kritikpunkt wäre, oder ich habe es nicht gefunden. (Dann wäre es entweder zu gut versteckt oder ich bin zu dämlich)
Ansonsten kann man, vor allem zu dem Preis, nicht meckern. Es ist auf jeden Fall eine interessante Erfahrung und für Freunde des Genres einen Blick wert.
Gruß Ziffi
Ziffi´s Spieletipps als Kurator: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2020
This game has a description that actually sounds interesting but the reality is different.

I played this on Oculus Rift which was rather painful, literally.

This is an escape room type game which consists of finding an object and bringing it to where depicted. There aren't actual puzzles or anything like that. Just ransack the place and find it. The good thing about the game is the use of time travel. Some objects can be accessed only from a different time period.
After certain time travel you end up in TimeLock where again you need to find an object and bring it somewhere. Also some enemies will spawn there and you can/have to shoot them down with a longbow.

The game is buggy and you can easily end up in a situation from which you cannot continue be it losing an item outside of the house or being it locked in the other time. I had to restart the game few times because of this. Wish the rewind time would have worked so I could have saved me the trouble of restarting again.

In general the game has bad graphics, distracting sounds, bad physics, bugs, very bad controls even though how that is possible is beyond me. I've been messing around Unity lately quite a lot and it surprises me how easily one can actually do something in it. The game feels like an unfinished student project or an attempt at a tutorial which totally missed the point of actually being a tutorial.

I paid like 0.5 EUR for that and I'm not even sure if that was worth it. Honestly I was glad the game was over so quickly.

Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2021
This was probably a fair VR game back when it was released in 2017, but it hasn't aged well.

The game is missing many simple quality of life improvements that you will find in newer games, from lacking any ability to turn (have fun getting wrapped up in your cord, and teleporting always retains the same facing) to archery controls that are finicky by the standards of a modern Oculus Home or newer game. Not only does the arrow often not want to connect to the bow when used quickly, but they travel slowly and in a huge arc. The designers must never have show a bow before in their lives, that's all I can say.

It's control scheme is also a bit awkward, because (at least on Oculus) it has an over-reliance on clicking the thumbsticks. Nothing is done just by moving them, it always has to be clicked, which gets old. Teleportation is the worst, because they decided to have it be every direction except forward, which is actually a laser pointer, to the opposite of most games.

Maybe this is a Vive thing, given this game was clearly made with that system in mind, but all of the gripping of objects is also on the trigger buttons instead of the grip buttons, which feels strange. You also lose access (for some reason) to directional cues on the controller holding something, while both movement and grabbing something at range are on the right hand, meaning you are often switching objects between hands.

The "combat" is also barely noticeable, effectively just a simple test demo that made it to the full game. Honestly, they could have omitted it entirely, and the game probably would have been the better for it. It adds nothing, only a minor "obstacle" during random interlude segments.

As for the gameplay, it's a sort of meh escape room experience. The solutions are pretty random, and not at all logical. Like, and these are spoilers for the first level, there's a password to a lockbox randomly written on a dirty window, so cleaning it gives you access to the box, which only has a lockpick in it to get to the next room. Also, you apparently need to grease a lock later before you can use a key on it, but the grease is frozen in a block of ice that you have to melt on a stove by finding a can of gasoline. It's just all that random. And worse, it's a mix of pixel hunting to figure out what thing you are supposed to use with also having a lot of things being laid out pretty explicitly. For example, There is text over the dirty window that basically says you should wash it, though finding a (dry) sponge can be laborious if you hadn't already run into it, and not even a in-universe "wash me" sort of thing, but literal text.

It's insulting to logic both from the perspective that it isn't logical, and that it holds your hand at the same time. This is particularly disappointing because the premise - switching between two times to solve puzzles - has a lot of premise. This does it no justice, though.

And then it jumps at random times into messed-up space-time world, where you get to fight enemies straight out of Atari using a bow. For reasons. Also, you get "puzzles" like "match the thing to its outline" and "shoot the big target".

And at least as far as I got, the story was both absent and intrusive. The entire gist of my playtime was "you part of time agency, you want vase, sometimes time go brrrr". That's not a story, that's a couple bullet points. And yet, it's constantly making you read your future texts for updates, and literally won't let you advance until you do. The red key won't open the red door until you read the text saying "congrats, you've found the key to the red door!"

Especially for $10, I recommend a hard pass on this game. Go for something much newer. For a few cents it might be worth it just to try, but it's honestly so dated at this point that I can't fully recommend it even if it were free.

(Also, the graphics are pretty poor, but that's to be expected of early VR.)
 
Thraxis, Lord of Chaos

Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2020
I bought this game on sale from HumbleBundle and while it was worth what I spent on it, I wouldn't recommend anymore buying this game in its current form.

The amount of content available as of 8/20/2020 is closer to a tech demo than an actual game. All the features of controlling time exist but are functionally useless. It's fun to mess around with the environment and throw things around just to pause time and make them float or reverse them back to where they were. However, these time control elements don't really have any impact on what is currently available. It's just a puzzle game where you can time travel between two different versions of a few of the rooms without any investment in the actual mechanization of the other time based features.

As it is now, I can't recommend it, but hopefully it will become the game that I hoped it would be when I purchased it.

Produit remboursé

TimeLock VR von Whale Rock Games.

Hm, wirklich gerockt hat mich das Game nicht. Es fing damit an, daß ich ertmal so geschockt von der miserablen Grafik war, daß bei mir kein Spielspaß oder Immersionsgefühl aufkam, allerdings nachdem ich vorher einen Grafikkracher gespielt hatte. Die moderne Welt ist in einem kubistischen, comicartigen Grafikstil gehalten, die Vergangenheit sieht schon "organischer" aus, ist dafür aber irgendwie unscharf. Evtl hab ich aber auch Grafikeinstellungen verpaßt, obwohl ich ein Menue gesucht habe.
Im Spiel selber scheinen mir hier und da die Texturen zu fehlen oder sind sehr schwammig und undeutlich.

Die Steuerung ist zudem etwas verkopft, nach etwas Übung geht es, es gibt intuitivere Steueungen... ständig hatte ich den Bogen in der Hand, obwohl ich das nicht wollte.
Man kann durch Wände greifen, Gegenstände fliegen durch die Gegend - wenn man nur dagegenstößt usw.

Ich kann TimeLock leider gar nicht empfehlen, wer Escaperoomspiele mag, könnte hier evtl. noch etwas Spaß haben. Alle anderen sollten auf einen Sale oder Gratisangebot warten.
Schade, denn die Idee hinter TimeLock ist gut, nur hapert es hier sehr an der Umsetzung.

English:
----------------------------------------->
TimeLock VR by Whale Rock Games.

Hm, the game did not really rock me. It started when I was so shocked by the miserable graphics for the first time, that I didn't feel any immersion or fun, but after I played a graphic blast before. The modern world is kept in a cubistic, comic-like graphic style, the past looks more "organic", but is somehow blurred. Maybe I missed some graphic settings, although I was looking for a menu.
In the game itself the textures seem to be missing here and there or are very spongy and indistinct.

The controls are also a bit messed up, after some practice it works, there are more intuitive controls... I always had the bow in my hand, although I didn't want to.
You can reach through walls, objects fly through the area - if you only hit them, etc.

Unfortunately I can't recommend TimeLock at all, if you like escaperoom games you might have some fun here. All others should wait for a sale or free offer.
It's a pity, because the idea behind TimeLock is good, but there is a big lack of implementation.

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2020
Neat concept with mediocre execution and no content.

The general criticism is true, unfortunately. The puzzles are extremely simple, no trial and error needed since every key item is very highlighted and only matches the corresponding symbol in a room. If a door is locked and you need a key, you will know which key you need since it literally shows you the symbol. There are no "huh what lock does that key fit" moments.

Also quite disappointing is the lack of content, there is nothing after the tutorial level. The game came out in August 2017 and has received no additional levels since then. Oof.

Useful would be a controls update for Index users because walking using the right stick is really, really bad. Better use the touch pad.

Occasionally you're put in a somewhat arcade area where you are shooting space invaders that make no sound so you barely even know they're there. To me that doesn't really fit into the escape room vibe this game puts up and is an unnecessary break from the main concept.

The lighting in this game is also very sub-par. Areas and objects that are in direct LOS of a lamp are completely dark in some places.

Overall, 2/10, fun for like half an hour or so but not worth the 8,19€ (current price). I got it on Humble Bundle for 0,97€ so I'm not mad about it.

Hope the developer decides to update the game, improve some things and adds a proper campaign eventually.

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2023
Time Lock VR 1 - игра, которая имеет свои плюсы и минусы. Давайте начнем с положительных сторон. Во-первых, графика в игре впечатляет своей детализацией и реалистичностью. Окружающие локации, текстуры и освещение создают привлекательную атмосферу для игрока. Во-вторых, геймплей предлагает интересные головоломки и вызовы, которые требуют находчивости и творческого мышления. Каждая миссия уникальна и разнообразна, делая игру захватывающей и интересной. В-третьих, Time Lock VR 1 полностью использует возможности виртуальной реальности, позволяя игрокам полностью погрузиться в игровой мир. Специальные контроллеры VR добавляют реалистичности и позволяют взаимодействовать с окружением. Наконец, звуковое сопровождение игры создает убедительную атмосферу и дополняет визуальную составляющую. Теперь перейдем к некоторым недостаткам. Во-первых, игра имеет небольшую продолжительность, что может вызвать разочарование у некоторых игроков, несмотря на ее увлекательность и интересность. Во-вторых, отсутствие мультиплеерного режима ограничивает возможность играть вместе с друзьями или другими игроками. Для тех, кто предпочитает совместные игровые сессии, это может быть недостатком. В-третьих, некоторые игроки могут заметить ограниченное разнообразие миссий, что может привести к повторению геймплея и некоторой монотонности. В итоге, Time Lock VR 1 предлагает увлекательный игровой опыт с прекрасной графикой, интересными головоломками и полной погруженностью виртуальной реальности. Однако, краткая продолжительность, отсутствие мультиплеера и ограниченное разнообразие миссий могут снизить удовлетворение от игры.

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2021
Привет всем обожателям жанра эскейп рум. Сразу отвечу на ваш вопрос, стоит ли тратить время на эту игру: Да, стоит.

А теперь по порядку.
В первую очередь, лично меня впечатлила графика, простота управления действиями, интересные "головоломки" (если их вообще можно так назвать) и парочка других фич, о которых я расскажу вам немного позже.

Во-первых, графика и прочие составляющие игры. Не мыло, но при этом об неё нельзя порезать свой взгляд во время игры, вполне приятно и современно на мой взгляд.

Второе, это интересного рода задания.
Сражение с врагами, необычная пальба по ним из лука? Да.
Поменять таймлайн? Абсолютно, да.
Поискать какой-нибудь ключик, который завалился в какую-то межпространственнную nuздy? Да!

Третье, приятный саунд. Вы когда-нибудь ностальгировали по майнкрафту, когда стреляете в какой-то игре из лука, звуковой эффект которого напомнил вам песочницу? Ну, самое время вернуть свой 2007. Буквально.

Расписывать каждый пункт можно просто до бесконечности. Ещё одним очевидным плюсом этой игры является её стоимость всего в пару десятков русских шекелей на момент написания обзора. Если у вас нет денег, потому что вы потратили последнюю копейку на VR, можете пойти просить или собирать мелочь на улицу, а затем кинуть её в ваш монитор.
Во время прохождения багов мной замечено не было. Единственное, вам может быть трудно в первое время искать какие-то предметы или допереть, какое действие нужно сделать, это решается пятиминутной головоломкой или трёхминутным поиском видео геймплея (если таковые имеются, но поскольку в интернете есть всё, думаю они найдутся). В принципе, на то это и паззл гейм.

Вердикт: Рекомендую! Общая оценка составляет 8 непонятных дронов-убийц из 10 .

Amazing Concept, Executed Horribly

You get these cool powers but you get nothing to do with them and the game is really short and buggy, I'm not saying don't get the game, but definitely wait for there to be more. The ending seriously blue balls you with a "wait for future updates" message. I love this concept of being able to do stuff with time manipulation, and to be honest, the puzzle parts of the game are actually really cool, but they're only half of this half hour experience, the other half is teleporting through a linear path with nothing to solve, and even in the puzzles, sometimes the crucial items would clip through the wall and never come back. Clipping is understandable, it's VR after all, but if something clips out, it should be able to come back. I look forward to seeing future updates and will update this review if a ton of new stuff is added, but for the time being, I cannot recommend this outside of being able to see a cool time stopping mechanic and solving a few escape room puzzles.

Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2019
This game was short and not very interesting. I finished it in thirty minutes, and I wasn't trying at all.

The "puzzles" were straightforward and marked with big, glowy glyphs showing you exactly what to do - obviously the developers were worried that players might have to use their brains a little bit during the game, so they took steps to remedy that situation.

The "time travel" is that each room has a past and future version, neither of which has any direct impact on the state of the other. If they'd left out the time travel and just made the house have eight rooms instead of four, it would have been the exact same game.

A couple of times, It is announced to you that your carrying an inventory item between past and present has triggered a so-called "time lock", which means you have to leave the house and wander a linear and uninterestingly surreal landscape ("Surreal" = "We had these game models lying around and didn't know what to do with them, so we threw them at random into a blue, blank void-type-place") until you do a pointless chore that somehow resolves the paradox you created(?) and lets you back into the house.
Some green floaty dudes show up on occasion during these sequences and you have to shoot arrows at them. If you don't, they shoot fireballs at you, but that's okay because from what I could tell, nothing meaningful happens when you get hit by these anyway. That's the so-called "action elements" in their entirety.

The game also gives the player the ability to pause and rewind time, which you will never actually use and indeed forget about entirely after the tutorial sequence forces you to push the buttons and confirm to yourself that they exist. I hope that next time they make something like this, the devs will design their gameplay and puzzles first, and develop the supporting mechanics only once they know what they're going to actually use them for. Maybe there's hope for that now that VR's been around for a bit longer and there's less pressure to rush any VR experience whatsoever to market while there are still so few options that people will buy anything that sounds kinda cool.

To the game's credit, there is a picure of a nice cat in a drawer. I liked that bit.

Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2018
About as much play as an IRL escape room, but much less interesting puzzles. The puzzles are always to root around in cupboards to find an item. The lighting and shaders are a bit poorly made, and there are a few objects which you can pick up but there is no texture on the reverse or underside. The game is pretty buggy too: I had to restart after I couldn't get my bow out any more, and it actually restarted from the beginning, so I don't think it saves progress at all. Also, you can't launch it from VR, as it shows the normal Unity resolution dialog when you start. Finally, when you finish the last puzzle, it just says that's the end of "episode one": there's no actual ending.

It's OK for the tiny price tag but it feels more like a hobby project or game jam entry than a commercial offering.

Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2022
Time Lock VR-1 é um jogo que simula um escape room, só que a diferença é que você pode voltar ou adiantar o tempo usando ele a seu favor (voltar ao passado pra pegar uma chave e usar ela no presente por exemplo). Foi a minha primeira experiência em VR e percebi que escolher esse jogo foi a pior besteira que já fiz. O jogo não está totalmente polido (poderiam ter caprichado muito mais); o jogo é muito curto (muito curto mesmo); os controles não são nada precisos; entre outros. Resumindo... ao invés de ter uma boa experiência com o jogo, parecia que eu estava jogando algo que ainda não estava pronto. Não da para recomendar um jogo assim, ainda mais por um preço desse (R$56,99). Nota 1/10. Não recomendo!

I just got a VR kit and have basically been trying everything I could get my hands on. This is my first VR game review and I just had to stay how bad this game is. This game was made in 2017 and it shows. Even if you can get this for less than a $1.00, save it on a candy bar. The graphics are pretty meh, the controls are clunky, and the physics glitchy. I had to give up because a book got lodged in the ground and would not stop making a noise.

When you first get in the game you are left with no instruction. Not even basic controls really. You need to mess around until you see your hands light up a button but only after you press buttons to make your bow go away. You are never told to grab anything and the time stuff is so poorly explained.

Just no. Go do anything else.

  • Very janky control scheme that you'd expect from the earliest days of VR. Until I figured it out I considered alt+F4ing.
  • The story doesn't make much sense. I think it was just cobbled together.
  • The puzzles were OK, but mostly involved throwing stuff around until you exhausted all of your other options. No satisfying "a-ha" moments. Just, "Oh, finally, here's the next thing I need."
  • Many positive reviews seem pretty sus as though someone may be paying to have them added. Similar wording, generic, a bit too enthusiastic.
  • Paid 40 cents and don't really feel ripped off, but ... uh ... it's close.

Отзывы все равно мало кто читает, оставлю рецепт манники:


Крупа манная - 1,5 стакана
Молоко - 1 стакан
Сахар - 1 стакан
Яйцо - 3 шт.
Масло сливочное - 50 г
Разрыхлитель - 1 пакетик
Соль - 1 щепотка

Яйца взбить с сахаром, солью и сливочным маслом.Добавить яично-сахарную смесь и разрыхлитель в манку, хорошо все перемешать.Полученную смесь вылить в форму для выпечки. (Силиконовая форма не нуждается в дополнительной подготовке, но если у вас металлическая основа, то лучше её застелить пергаментной бумагой или смазать основание и боковины маслом.)Уберите форму с пока ещё жидким манником в хорошо разогретую духовку до 180 градусов на 50-60 минут. И остудить не забудьте.

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2023
Timelock VR is an immersive virtual reality game with a unique twist: time manipulation.

Players navigate through intricately designed rooms, solving puzzles and using time control mechanics to advance. The visuals are stunning, and the integration of action elements adds to the excitement.

However, I would have liked to see:
- deeper story,
- more features.

Overall, Timelock VR is recommended for fans of virtual reality and puzzle games. But still, I would have liked some fine-tuning, but even at this stage, you can see that the game has been worked on.

Прошёл игру и могу подвести итоги.
Игра действительно хороша в идеи управлении времени.
Минусов ОЧЕНЬ много, а плюсов дико мало.
Плюсы:
1 - не очень сложные головоломки
2 - можно пострелять из лука
3 - управлять временем
Минусы:
1 - Плохое управление (выбор лука, паузы и т.д.)
2 - Нельзя вертеть камерой при движении левого стика в право и лева
3 - ОЧЕНЬ короткая игра
4 - В начале долго привыкаешь к управлению (по крайней мере у меня)
5 - Слишком лёгкие враги
6 - Не очень хорошая физика (например детский мячик не подпрыгивал)
Заключение:
Игра своих 777 рублей ВООБЩЕ не стоит.
Хорошо, что сейчас скидка на неё -90%, а набор так вообще стоил 15 рублей ( -99% )
Совет: Покупать эту игру не советую, лучше покупать сразу набор с другой игрой, которая на данный момент стоит 108 рублей ( -93% )

Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2023
INDEX USER WARNING
==================
- No grip support (you grip with trigger like all other early VR era games)
- Controllers change from time to time into custom HTC controllers which can confuse button layout
B button on your left swaps in between time
Right Thumbpad or joystick down to move
Try to always grab keys/objects you need to teleport between both "times" in your left hand

General
======
You press a button to switch in between old and new versions of a tiny 4 room apartment.
I beat the game in about half an hr using none of the "time control" features specified in neither the intro video nor the opening tutorial (which for Index Users is fair)

All in all this game isn't worth my or your time anymore if it were free, don't install

2) The Physics in this game is a little off. For example I picked up the key in the bookshelf and when it fell on the floor it just kind off....disappeared.
3) Movement wise - the game is alright.
4) The graphics are decent...very odd choice in colours, but I'm not too picky.
5) The Enemies aren't really...well y'know....Enemies. They don't do any damage to you. And you basically one-shot them.
6) Their is no real music in this game, the trailer is misleading.
7) Puzzles are decent. Took me a little while to figure out what the first safe's password was.

I would give this game a 6.5/10, just because it was short, decent and easy on the eyes. If you want to buy this game, wait for a sale, otherwise don't bother.

21 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2022
It could have been good...
It was super short, basically demo length and incomplete.
I played this game on my Samsung Odyssey Plus. From the get go I realised once taking off my headset I had to to start the game on the actual desktop. Once I loaded in I found my face right up against the German flag on the language. There was a very awkward phase at the first step of the tutorial to get some time module I didn't know what to interact with. (still don't know how I got past it) Since my headset was wired I didn't appreciate that I had to physically turn my head irl rather than use my joy stick to turn. Thank god you could travel by teleportation ;-;
The map was janky with your hands able to grab objects from behind closed shelves that werent locked, was able to teleport through some walls on occasion.

There were some positives. I did enjoy the time-manipulating mechanic, I thought the idea was really cool which is why I was so bummed that I never ended up actually using it for anything to achieve the objective. The combat to beat the robots was meh, unpolished, but I had fun with it even if I couldn't aim that well with it. Puzzles were fairly straight forward with the little twist of having to jump through time to grab certain objects and take them to another time plane.

Overall I think the game has potential, but it felt VERY far from finished. I would have happily waited for more updates if this was a demo and see how this game would be as a fully fleshed product where the time-manipulation mechanic actually had some use and they got rid of the bugs I mentioned. However based on the time-stamps of some of these reviews.. I doubt that's going to happen. As my dad once said to me "I'm not mad... just disappointed"

USE TIME MACHINE TO SOLVE THE PUZZLES

Time Agents may interact with the objects in different ways: slow down the object time, make time rewinds or even transport objects between timelines!

All quests are build with Time Travel mechanic in mind.
FIGHT ENEMIES AND BEAT MINIGAMES

Time Agents must be ready to fight different enemies and even bosses during the Time Travel.

Use special weapons and Time Control Tools to succeed every action moment!
FULLY INTERACTIVE VR ENVIRONMENT

TimeLock VR offers a fully functional environment with lots of interactions: you can throw objects, open every cabin, turn lighting on and off and much more.

Each room can be visited in different timelines.

0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2021
I'm not sure why this game has the rating it does. It took me 20 minutes to figure out the controls, and another 30 minutes to complete the whole "game". Even after figuring out the controls it was difficult to move around as I can't control the direction I look. I don't feel like I ever completely figured out the controls.

You hop between 2 different years with the press of a button to get all the items. The game description talks about changing the speed of time but this mechanic doesn't seem to exist in the game.

The only redeeming features I found is that the graphics are actually quite good, especially for a game made back in 2017. However this doesn't help save the game from pretty much failing in every other area.

The plot is to steal a vase. There's no explanation for why this vase is required, but it doesn't really matter. Spoiler alert: the vase is just in the other room. You just need to collect a few keys to open some doors to get it, and then the game is finished.

There are a few things that appear at key points, which I assume are supposed to be the baddies, that I had to shoot with my bow and arrow. Again, not much of an explanation as to what these things are and why I have to kill them. Are they also fine vase collectors? They fired some balls things at me, but there's no health in this game so this wasn't a challenge.

The game ends with a fizzle. The vase disappears and you're just left standing there with a promise someone will contact you if they need you again. 4 years later and they're still content with their vase and haven't asked me to collect anything else for them.

Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2021
This was a short demo at best. It took maybe 30 minutes, my 60 minutes are because I had to keep restarting because it has NO SAVE POINTS and things would glitch through walls and the floors. The rewind gimmick is was never useful for this at all and would never work anytime I actually wanted it to.

The game is also not playabe seated. Not at all.
You can't even select english language without standing up on the very first screen. As a handicapped person this game was just a nightmare of frustration and I had to use walkinvr to get through it at all. The game would not have been playable at all seated without that amazing app.

The game is also very much designed for the original vive controllers and the mappings for the oculus touch were confusing and awkward.

I paid less than a dollar for this and didn't get my money's worth.

Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2021
This was a better VR game than I expected. It is well polished and I found the controls intuitive. With a rewind feature and a pause time feature to help control what happens to thrown objects accidentally dropping something or missing a throw was not a problem. This was also one of the few VR games I have become immersed enough in that I ended up punching my wall and bed a couple times. Overall it took me about an hour to beat the first time though I am not the best at puzzle games.

A friend gifted it to me while it was on sale and I just recently played it. While it is quite short I had fun trying to get through the game as fast as I could. Eventually i got my time down to 5 minutes and 58 seconds.

Overall i would highly recommend this game if you want a fun puzzle game with some bow shooting action.

퀘스트 2로 버추어 데스크탑으로 돌리니 실행이 되어 해볼수 있었다.

다른 시간대의 집안을 시간여행하며 꽃병을 훔쳐서 탈출 하는 방탈출 게임인데
생각보다 퍼즐이 어렵지 않아서 할만 했다.

활과 화살이 왜 필요했나 생각이 들었지만
시간이 꼬였을때 해결하기 위한 도구였다.

나름 할만은 했지만
돈 다주고 하기엔 좀 아까운 분량의 컨텐츠라서
대폭 세일 할때(한 90프로 이상세일?) 사서 한다면
추천할만 하다.

다음은 업데이트 안될듯.

I was enjoying this despite the lack of direction on buttons (I spent 15 minutes trying to figure out what the "laser module" was and what I needed to use it on). Then I started playing through the initial level. The controls are a little clunky, but they work well enough to play a puzzle game.

I bought this a long time ago so I doubt I can get a refund.

Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2020
I would call this game a demo of whats coming and would be possible in the future. For a full-fledged game is was to short and feels unfinished. There are features that don't have a purpose, like the time-stop/rewind thing.

Positive
  • The idea to switch between different times to solve puzzles has lot of potential. It worked great on Day of the Tentacle. But i would wish that it does not only consists of taking things from A to B, but also changes in the past would affect the future.
  • The computer that is integrated to the virtual controllers.

Negative
  • The "Time-Lock" parts felt misplaced and didn't match the rest of the game. Their level-design looked like someon quickly clicked some assets together and it could not catch up with the rest of the game.
  • Some clipping-bugs, which lead to some objects falling through others or weirdly bouncing things.
  • No possiblility to turn around ingame. You have to turn around in real life.

Because it was in sale for under 1€ it was worth it. But i would not buy it for the full price.

Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2020
Picked it up fairly cheaply while getting into VR with WMR.

Graphics leave a lot to be desired for, same with the physics and foley work. Tossing bottles and plates onto the floor is outstandingly disappointing, and around half-way through the game (episode, really) the rewind and pause features stopped working. Not that it mattered, however, since they were only used for the demo at the very beginning before dropping you into your first heist.

The story has a lot of room for improvement, perhaps just being a demo of sorts made it seem nonsensical in the attempt to get the player right into the game proper. Exposition was delivered via text that I wasn't able to scroll back onto.

Puzzles consisted of opening cabinets and drawers until you found the next step forward; a sponge for a dirty mirror which gave a code, etc. Fairly linear, but the game does expect things done in order. Overall, I wouldn't pay more than 5 dollars for TimeLock VR especially not until there are more "episodes" beyond just the first vase heist.

4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2018
Annoyingly had two crashes and a glitch that has stopped me from completing the game just before the end (weapon got lost). And it appears that there is no way to save the game, or exit it, so you kinda need to do it all in one go.

This is the second VR game that I have played (the other was FORM).

I would recommend this game still. I think that the gameplay is probably 1.5 hours end-to-end. So given that you can't save do make sure you have the time to enjoy it.

There are a couple of complaints that people have made it seems:
1) Game doesn't work - It is annoying that it pops up a windowed item on your desktop before the game starts. This makes it look like it crashed in Steam VR. I needed to alt-tab to get the window up, select/confirm the resolution then the game started.
2) Some say they are dumped into a dark room, have spent 30 minutes there and can't work out what to do. If you look at the controllers in the game, you will see that there are flashing buttons (arguably these aren't easy to miss if you know they are there, but if you don't them maybe people don't look at their hands?). These don't exactly match up with my controller, as I am in WMR and this is a game where the controllers are meant to be tools. The first button (for me on WMR) is the slightly raised 'burger' or menu button.
3) Being stuck somewhere in the game going back and forth and not getting anywhere - Some of the 'puzzles' require lateral thinking. It is part of the enjoyment of an 'escape' style game where you have to think differently. I was stuck in one area for about 15 minutes, but once you have worked it out, it is good.


The majority of the game is decently rendered, pretty effects. There is no control over going through walls if you are walking, thus you can cheat in some aspects, try not to, it spoils the game for yourself.

Definitely try not to watch any videos/walkthroughs, it would be easy to spoil the enjoyment.

Replaying it now it took about 14 minutes to complete. So as it stands the game doesn't have a lot of replayability, but I guess that is normal for this style of game.

Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2017
Gameplay Video:
Vidéo YouTube™: VR Sunday: Time Lock VR 
Vues : 503
An Escape room with time travel mechanics? Count me in. Also i'm still plagued with technical problems, as the camera cut out in the last 10-15 minutes -.- TimeLock VR is an Escape the Room with...


I love the concept of this game! An escape room kinda puzzle game with time travel mechanics, with a bit of exploring and fighting mixed in. The game was short but sweet and the changing of time periods was a very satisfying mechanic.
Every once and a while you get to get out of the house into this surreal environment to get back an object that was lost in time. Enemies attack you and you got to defend yourselve with your trusty bow. Nice and short!

There are a few negative things that need to be adressed: Sometimes the physics were way off and it seemes there are a few sounds missing from the game. Best example are the enemies that "sneak" up behind you.

The price you pay is fair i would say.

Overall i think this has a great potential. Imagin a bigger house, and 3-4 different Time periods to go to.

Pretty nice escape the room game. Secret of success is having one feature, that will help this game stand out of tons of others. And this one have to features - time travelling and action element. Fully interactive environment also can be named as feature of this game. That was really fun. Game is not very durable, but made me and my family spend a couple of hours resolving quests and just having fun.
Will I recommend it? Definately YES!
